author: Staff Reporter
text:
The State Government pensioners and family pensioners who have been drawing pension through the district treasury and sub-treasuries under pilot scheme have been directed to appear for mustering at the treasury or sub-treasury concerned on working days between April 1 and June 30.

According to a release, pensioners are required to bring their pension payment order book, bank passbook indicating the core banking savings account number, PAN card, ration card and Aadhaar card (if available).

Family pensioners are required to produce non re-marriage certificate along with the above documents.

Pensioners who are unable to appear in person can send the life certificate along with copies of the documents.

The life certificate should be attested by the bank manager of the pension receiving branch, gazetted officers of the State or Central governments or officers in the rank of tahsildhar, deputy tahsildhar or revenue inspector.

The payment would be stopped from August 15 for those who failed to appear for the annual mustering or furnish the life certificate till June 30.

The format of life certificate and non-re-marriage certificate could be downloaded fromwww.tn.gov.in/karuvoolam.
title: Pensioners called for mustering from April 1 to June 30
